ovdesc.p: This table will be used to define the eight Standing Order types which are covered within the Standing Order Application. The only purpose of this file is to allow the User to define Descriptions in various languages for each one of the eight types. This table will be used by the Standing Order main Application and needs, therefore, to be created before starting to load Standing Order instructions.

desc.p: This field provides a default value for the field DAYS.DELIVERY in STO for the STO type of STO.This specifies the number of working days to add to the STO frequency date to give the value date of a standing order.
Describes the Standing Order Type and is used to provide the enrichment of the code.

This field can be expanded to allow the User to enter the Description of the standing order type in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new language as defined in the Language table and will indicate to the User the Language in which the Description must be entered.
1 to 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters Multilanguage field. Multivalue field. (Mandatory Input.)
Identifies the type of the Standing Order.

The eight different types of Standing Order must be defined in the same format as described below. These types have been hardcoded in the program and any other code will be refused by the Application.
The following values will be accepted:
Balance Management Standing Order Types
BI Balance Maintenance In. An account is to be maintained at a minimum balance level and Payments In needs to be effected when the balance is below the specified balance.
BO Balance Maintenance Out. An account to be maintained at a maximum balance level and that Payments Out need to be effected when the balance is in excess of the specified balance.
BP Principal amount on the account paid out. A fixed term savings account that needs to pay out the balance on the account at the end of its term can use this type.
Regular Payments Standing Order Types
FI The customer has given instructions to the bank to pay on a regular basis a Fixed amount by the debit of one of his accounts.
PP The customer has authorised the bank to pay bills from third parties upon presentation of these bills. The amount, for this type of Standing Order is unknown.
PPI The customer gives instructions to the bank to pay away any interest capitalised on a savings account to another account.
Diary Standing Order Types
DIARY Used to define any type of Diary instructions on a specific account.
Direct Debit Standing Order Type
DD The bank has a direct debit mandate from the Customer which authorises the bank to accept direct debits received on the Account.
Up to 5 type SSS (uppercase alpha) characters as defined in Details. Any other value will be refused. (Mandatory input. No default.)

This field is used to specify the events for which delivery message has to be generated for a STANDING.ORDER. Events like modification, cancellation or expiry of a STO record could be setup here to generate advices. When this is left blank, the default delivery advice would be generated only during creation or modification of a standing order record.

p.p: Valid values are AMEND, EXPIRY, CANCEL, ALL or blank

desc.p: Optional field
This field indicates whether the STO.TYPE supports generation of FUNDS TRANSFER from STANDING.ORDER, 'n' days prior to the Frequency Date as mentioned in DAYS.PRIOR
Optional input
Valid values are CVD and Blank
Allowed only when DAYS.PRIOR is entered
This field indicates the number of days prior to the frequency date, on which the FT is to be generated
Optional input
Valid values are nW, nC and Blank, where 'n' stands for the number of days
Allowed only when PROC.DATE.TYPE is entered

This field is used to specify the events for which delivery message has to be generated for a STANDING.ORDER. Events like modification, cancellation or expiry of a STO record could be setup here to generate advices. When this is left blank, the default delivery advice would be generated only during creation or modification of a standing order record.

p.p: Valid values are AMEND, EXPIRY, CANCEL, ALL or blank

desc.p: Optional field

This field is used to specifiy if the FUNDS.TRANSFER record generated via STO processing should be put on hold or should this be created immediately. If this is set to YES, then, FT would be put on hold for user modification else FT would be generated immediately and authorised by system automatically.

p.p: Valid values are YES OR left blank

desc.p: This field is used to specify the FUNDS.TRANSFER version to be used while generating the FT from STO.

p.p: Should be a valid ID in the VERSION table and the version should be for FUNDS.TRANSFER application.

desc.p: This field is used to specify the FT.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION id. If given this would be defaulted in the STO that is created for this sto type.

p.p: Should be a valid ID in the file FT.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION.

desc.p: This field is used to specify the PAYMENT.ORDER.PRODUCT id. If defined, then the respective version record will be defaulted in the STO record when the STO type is used

p.p: Input allowed only when PI product is installed else this will be a NOINPUT field.
Should be a valid record in the file PAYMENT.ORDER.PRODUCT

desc.p: This field is used to specify the PAYMENT.ORDER version to be used while generating the Payment Order from STO when SUPPRESS.FT is set to PAYMENT

p.p: Input allowed only when PI product is installed else this will be a NOINPUT field.
Must be valid Payment order version record
